name: Web3 social for Zuzalu
description:
If blockchain is changing the way we cooperate globally, then Web3 social could be the future of online communication. Today we’re always a click away from being de-platformed by centralized social networks. Web3 social could become a “credible neutral” basis for our communication and online collaboration. But the decentralized nature of these networks also raises important questions about data privacy, ownership and governance that we must address.

Sever and Martin are working at the AKASHA Foundation. Since releasing our first experiment, the on-chain AKASHA app in 2017 the space has evolved quite a bit. We see different protocols popping up such as Farcaster, ATProtocol (bluesky), Nostr….

We would like to invite you to a brainstorming workshop discussing all about Web3 social this Thursday, March 30 from 5 to 6pm.

Here’a s list of topics we could cover - but feel free to also bring your own: 

- What does Web3/ decentralized social really mean?
- What is minimal viable decentralization?
- Comparing existing protocols for new social apps (federated vs decentralized) …and why/ do we need so many?
- What governance (DAOs) and moderating for new online communities do we need?
- What might a Zuzalu native social app look like?
- ...

Where? 
We are in apartment C904. The best way to get there is through our terrace next to the outdoor pool. We posted a map in the #web3-social channel on discord.

name: Future of Zuzalu (and forks)
equipment: Ability to do slide presentations / share screen
description:
A collaborative session, with both presentations and tools like sli.do and pol.is, to gain a better understanding of what Zuzaluans want out of possible future rounds of the concept, as well as a deep dive into economic and other practicalities. Intended as a "round 1". Topics may include:

* What long-term things do people want? A permanent crypto+bio+philosophy town in Montenegro? A roaming nomad village? Once a year, or year round? Multiple forks?
* The economics of organizing, including costs and how to achieve economic sustainability, saving money by mass booking off-peak, etc
* The logistics and other practical complexities of organizing
* The tradeoffs of independent resorts vs "embedded inside a town"
* Which countries to go to
* Social tradeoffs: how to balance being inclusive and not becoming an elite enclave, vs keeping the number of sketchy people, aggressive and power-seeking people, etc down. Should there be resident vs visitor distinctions, what should those look like? etc
* Governance

Network states & new cities with longevity at heart

  • Definitions
    • get everyone’s definitions
    • agree on rough guidelines
  • Implementation
    • strategies for nation building
    • land
    • diplomacy - interstate relations, between legacy States but also between Network States
    • Governance
  • Societal systems
    • law, healthcare, education, scientific record
    • eg crypto-friendly zone
  • Business model
    • financial viability

name: Zuzalu Townhall Activation
description:
This interactive gathering that is HIGHLY encouraged for all current residents to attend. This is your chance to help shape the future of our community! Come collaborate with other Zuzalians, and make a meaningful impact on our collective vision for Zuzalu now and in the future.


Our pop-up city is unlike any other and evolving rapidly. Your insights and creativity are invaluable in driving the growth of our community, and this meeting is the perfect opportunity to channel that energy into transformative ideas and projects.


As residents of the Zuzalu community, your participation is crucial for our continued success. We encourage you to bring your most ambitious ideas and an open mind, ready to constructively criticize, contribute and find solutions to support the growth and development of Zuzalu.


Telegram group to discuss questions and projects from this session.

name: Public Goods Week Kickoff Session
description: Join us as we kick off the Public Goods Week. We will give you an overview of the week and discuss the different ways you can support the advancement of public goods. Everyone is welcome!

name: Optimism RPGF round 2 recap + learnings
description:
Join the Optimism team as they discuss the recent RPGF round and what they learned from it.


All are welcome.

name: Protocol Guild: Funding Ethereum's Core Protocol Work
info: Part of Public Goods week schedule
description: This talk will give an overview of Protocol Guild: a mechansism to route donations from the Ethereum community to core protocol maintainers in an incentive-compatible way. We will first decribe what Protocol Guild is & how it works, then go over the initial PG pilot, future plans for the guild, and finally answer audience questions.

name: Public Goods Funding: the Race to the Bottom
description: Gitcoin will walk us through its funding details to date and explore how we might identify sustainable, recurring revenue sources for public goods in the future. You won’t want to miss it.

name: Public Goods Public Perception
description:
Public Goods” is at risk of becoming a catch-all term, and the more successful genuine efforts are, the more likely it is to attract grifters.  How can we better frame what we mean by public goods? Where/how should the Ethereum community draw the line, and how can we design related incentives to achieve better support for them?

Join the teams from Gitcoin, Supermodular, Protocol Labs, and Optimism as we discuss the current perception of Public Goods and collabratively work towards solutions to the problems we are facing.

name: Evening Keynote : How Do We Build Public Goods Infrastructure Together?  W/ Evan Miyazono
description: Join Evan Miyazono from Protocol Labs as we have an open discussion around building Public Goods infrastructure.  Everyone is welcome!

name: Goals for Public Goods Funding
description:
Join us for a conversation outlining the full stack of the public goods ecosystem, and learn how you can plug in to help move the ecosystem forward.

Themes:

The why and how of unified interfaces/taxonomies/structures for decision and funding-allocation mechanisms, and:

  • What that means for hackers and researchers
  • How that can be made regenerative (tldr: by facilitating external use cases)
  • Emerging primitives for public goods

name: Public Goods Nightly Wrap Up
description: Each Night of Public Goods week we are going to come together and highlight the upcoming event of the next day. This is the communities opportunity to highlight any upcoming workshops, breakout sessions, or gatherings that will be happening in the next 24 hrs or highlight any discussions that happened in that day.

name: Shapella fork party
description:
The Shapella fork, whose flagship feature is enabling ETH stakers to withdraw (see https://blog.ethereum.org/2023/03/28/shapella-mainnet-announcement), is taking place at 22:27 UTC on Apr 12 (that's 00:27 local time on Apr 13). We can watch the fork happening live, and talk about what is going into the fork, some technical details and some questions about what is likely to happen to the Ethereum base layer in the next few forks in the future.

Actual time for this would be 23:45 Apr 12 - 01:00 Apr 13 local time, in the coworking space aka ballroom.

name: Presenting Michael Smith - Inventor of a revolutionary regenerative technology (Regen AI - DeSci - Blockchain - Public good)
info: Please help me get people to this. It’s important and mind blowing.
equipment: Big screen. Ability to zoom. We need it recorded.
description:
Michael Smith is the Inventor of the Earth Power Lodge which was showcased in a documentary that won over ten awards and has more than 25,000,000 views. 

His invention turns biomass waste into power, organic food, fertilizer and soil amendments while purifying water and sequestering CO2. His system uses AI ML. He's keen on open source decentralization. 

You don't want to miss this talk. It's a game changer.

To top it off you can build one of these things starting at around 2million and do 4million in revenue the first year - while doing amazing things for the planet.

We are incredibly fortunate that he's making time to present to us. Please join in. He will zoom into the Dome.

name: Philosophy Discussion on Death & Meaning of Life
info: Join us for a thought-provoking small group discussion on Death & Meaning of Life! This will be the first in a series of discussions exploring some fundamental questions about what it means to be alive. We'll start by exploring why we fear death, what death means to us, and the nature of immortality. No philosophy background is needed; anyone who is curious about these questions is welcome to join. Please note that sign-ups are limited to 10 people on a first-come-first-serve basis.

name: Hypercerts and Impact Certification - Holke Brammer
Retro Public Harms and Behavioral Game Theory
description: Public Goods Games have been studied in experimental economics for decades. First we will play one live. Then I will discuss the replicated results as well as implications for cryptoeconomic design. We will close by discussion a novel application for credibly suppressing MEV by penalizing “retro public harms.

This session takes place in the DOME during the Public Goods Hackathon.

name: Hackathon Submission, Pitching and Judging
description:
We will conclude the hackathon weekend at 1pm with all participants submitting at 1pm followed by lunch.

Pitching at 1:30-2:45pm

2:45-3pm winners announced

As a reminder the hackathon was focused on public goods and there were two tracks. Building public goods for Zuzalu and any public good in general. 

For Zuzalu, the detailed prompts are listed here. 

The hackathon was run on Buidlbox.io and there is a $10K prize sponsored by Gitcoin.

name: Roundtable Topics Lunch: Zero Knowledge & ID
description:
Roundtable Topics Lunch #1

Zero Knowledge & ID: What can the ZKPassport unlock? 

Conversation prompts: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PbHG6lv-f6V1szkJug-b-6vMsu0EIcFNsIUXzlgNHf8/edit#

Join us for the ZK Roundtable Topic Lunches and chat with fellow Zuzalu community members about existing and future zk use cases and applications. 

The lunches will be held in a relaxed and informal setting and are open to individuals of all levels of expertise. They will take place on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at 21 Bistro, starting at 12 noon. Each lunch will have a unique theme and a set of guiding questions to help drive the discussion. Come and brainstorm some novel zk use-cases with us, and learn more about the exciting world of zk tech.

Lunch will be paid for by Zuzalu/0xPARC. There is limited capactiy, first come first serve.

custom_location: Town House 14 -- please see google maps link in description

name: Deploy your own on-chain zkml models with ezkl
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great! Screen or projector and a whiteboard with markers
description:
Running ai/ml models in a zero-knowledge proof makes it as though they run on chain. This lets the chain perceive the world and gives smart contracts the ability to exercise judgement. Learn how to take your own ML models and turn them into provers and on-chain verifiers using our open-source tool ezkl (https://github.com/zkonduit/ezkl). Beginner-friendly, but we will also delve into some technical and mathematical details for the interested.

Target audience: People who are new to ZK but who have a technical background, or are experienced with ZK and are curious about the technical details of how ezkl works.
Beginner-friendly, but we will also delve into some technical and mathematical details for the interested. 






 






People who are new to ZK but who have a technical background, or are experienced with ZK and are curious about the technical details of how ezkl works.

name: Intro: Folding Scheme Math Building Blocks
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: Nova’s [KST21] folding scheme is a lightweight protocol for recursive proof composition. This session lays the mathematical groundwork for understanding the components of a folding scheme, and introduces the contexts in which it is useful. We will cover primitives such as vector commitment schemes, random linear combinations, the Fiat-Shamir transform, as well as incrementally verifiable computation and zk-SNARKs on a high level.

name: Hacking Zuzalu Passport Workshop #1
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: TBD

name: Womens Circle  (women only)
description:
Our weekly women's circle in Zuzalu is a safe and confidential space for female residents to connect with their divine feminine and strengthen sisterhood. Through guided meditation, reflection, and discussion, we deepen our understanding of ourselves and each other. This co-created space encourages participants to open up and share their life experiences, challenges, and celebrations, fostering a deeper connection with others. Join our community of supportive and like-minded women, and experience the transformative power of feminine energy. This is an opportunity to connect with your true self and build meaningful relationships with other women in your community.

If you would like to join, we request that you stay for the duration of the experience. We will be closing door at 7:35pm.

name: ZK Drop in Coworking at the Chedi
description: TBD

name: Human Digital Twin
description: Please bring your macbook or equivalent. This workshop will introduce at how to use your data to optimize your life big picture as well as complete small tasks and daily planning "on autopilot."

name: Level up your personal brand
description: Brand and storytelling sessions

name: Gitcoin Grants Office Hours
description: Get help to apply for the upcoming Gitcoin grants round

name: Future Scaling Discussion
description:
Meta Discussion about the Future of Zuzalu.

What kind of time scaling will Zuzalu have? Is this meant to last for years, decades, centuries?
I wonder if there's something special about the ~200 person number. How do we scale an intentional community beyond Dunbar's Number?

name: Zuzalu Townhall
description:
This interactive gathering that is HIGHLY encouraged for all current residents to attend. This is your chance to help shape the future of our community! Come collaborate with other Zuzalians, and make a meaningful impact on our collective vision for Zuzalu now and in the future.


Our pop-up city is unlike any other and evolving rapidly. Your insights and creativity are invaluable in driving the growth of our community, and this meeting is the perfect opportunity to channel that energy into transformative ideas and projects. It also gives you a sense of all that is going on week by week in our community and how you can get the most out of your contribution during your time here.

As residents of the Zuzalu community, your participation is crucial for our continued success. We encourage you to bring your most ambitious ideas and an open mind, ready to constructively criticize, contribute and find solutions to support the growth and future of Zuzalu.

name: Build a ZK circuit in Halo2 - the easy way
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great! Screen projector
description:
Learn how to build a ZK circuit in Halo2 using our opinionated halo2-lib framework. We will provide documentation, scaffolding, and tooling as well as personal guidance.

Come with your project ideas or try one of our suggestions!

Audience:
ZK application developers who are looking for an easy-to-use Plonkish framework to build performant applications.

name: Pilates with Resistance bands
description: Bring a mat from the zuzalu gym or coworking space !

name: Next steps on the Polygon zkEVM
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great! Easel with markers and screen/projector
description: After the Polygon zkEVM Mainnet Launch, we will review the experience and insights of this milestone and the next steps to follow.

name: Intro to Nova
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: This workshop will introduce Nova, a simple yet powerful recursive SNARK proof system. We'll start by highlighting the amazing properties Nova enjoys for incrementally verifiable computation (IVC). We'll then introduce the main Nova building block called a "folding scheme", explain the details of how Nova works for R1CS, and tease some of the generalisations of Nova including SuperNova and HyperNova.

name: Enterprise Privacy Using ZK
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: A short talk about where things stand in building privacy technology for blockchains after Tornado cash.  EY is still committed to building privacy technology but we've had to modify our approach.  I'll share what we're doing and how we're trying to make confidentiality work for enterprises while preserving the permissionless and open ecosystem approach on Ethereum.  The presentation will be non-technical.

name: Chedi Sauna Philosophers
description:
Join us in the Chedi Sauna at 19:00 for chill music and philosophical discussion on a wide range of topics.

Quantum physics, Consciousness, Ancient History, Sacred Geometry, Futurism.

An hour is set aside here, however, people are encouraged to only spend as much time in the sauna as is right for their health. Quiet conversations can continue in the pool or spa lounge area also.

name: Nova Dinner
description:
Open-dinner for folks interested in Nova, casual discussion 🙂

Dinner tab covered by Zuzalu/0xPARC
Limited seating -- first come, first serve

name: ZK Drop in Coworking at the Chedi
description: TBD

name: Blockchain use case in Africa
info: I need builders, the community to attend so we can have a fruitful conversation and have a roadmap to scale the use case in Africa.
description:
I am the founder of ayaversity.com; we are primarily focused on early-stage companies. Aya has a unique approach that harnesses talent with a startup mindset through our Ethereum-focused training in smart contact, product design, and product management, utilizing soulbound NFTs powered by blockchain technology to create social identities for each candidate to build their on-chain proof of work.

I am one of those who believe Ethereum and its ecosystem must have a plan for Africa in real-time. This is why, Africa has the world's youngest population and has an actual use case for blockchain. It is nice to have it in the West. I'm not technical, but my ideals have impacted 33 African countries. So I will be happy to see the possibility of having a session to discuss “Blockchain as a need-use case for Africa." 

-"How do we empower 10 million young Africans with the key skills to contribute and build scaleable solutions on Ethereum, Layer 2, and other EVMs?"

- How to use community building to make EF have a strong physical penetration in the continent that has real use cases for the technology.

The next billion users are tied to millions with digital knowledge and skills. Africa will play this key role in utility, usability, and adoption.

see you at the dome.

name: Nova Track Ad-Hoc Session: ZK Week Research Projects Discussion
description: Ad-hoc session to discuss Nova open research problems and technical note explainer projects that we can make progress on this week.

name: Roundtable Topics Lunch: Zero Knowledge into other domains
description:
The focus of this lunch will be the use of ZK in other domains, such as games, DeFi, social media, and more. Join us to brainstorm some novel ZK use-cases, and learn more about the exciting world of ZK tech.

The lunches will be held in a relaxed and informal setting and are open to individuals of all levels of expertise. They will take place on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at 21 Bistro, starting at 12 noon. Each lunch will have a unique theme and a set of guiding questions to help drive the discussion. Come and brainstorm some novel zk use-cases with us, and learn more about the exciting world of zk tech.

Lunch will be paid for by Zuzalu/0xPARC. We've reserved space for up to 30 people, first come, first served. If reserved tables are full, you're welcome to join in the conversation but you'll need to pay for your own order.

Looking forward to hear about your readings.

name: Lattice-based crypto 101
equipment: Screen/project, whiteboard or digital whiteboard. Record if possible
description:
I will be presenting the basics of lattice-based cryptography and the reason that conducted us to build on it to design the proof system Vortex.

Target Audience: People who are familiar with ZK but new to lattice-based cryptography.

name: Advanced Folding Schemes
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: This workshop will provide an in-depth exploration of advanced folding scheme constructions, the building blocks that enable Nova's efficient and simple recursion scheme. We will begin by delving into Sangria, a folding scheme for PLONK. Next, we will discuss Nova's extension to support higher degree gates and lookups. And finally, we will explore speculative alternative ideas for adding in-circuit randomness and how Nova's PLONK-ish framing may point to a reframing of IVC itself.

To sign up, please fill in the form here: https://airtable.com/shrTr2h2AxSUmAY4e

I (Gary) would love to play some Amapiano for you all on a speaker -- which is a South African origin electronic music genre that I can't get enough of. And I'm very open to other people with their own suggestions of what emerging world music we should listen to.

Chill environment, sitting on floor, dancing is optional.

name: Embodiment Weekend - Opening Ceremony
info: We need the chairs cleared out
description:
LilaB - Laboratory of Embodiment and Movement: A wild combination of yoga techniques, movement research and ecstatic practices.

Welcome are so excited to announce the upcoming embodiment workshop, LilaB, a laboratory of embodiment and movement.
This is designed for people of all backgrounds, age, gender identity and experience levels. 

Embodiment is the practice of exploring the connection between your body and mind. It's about bringing your attention to your physical sensations, emotions, and movements, and using them to deepen your understanding of yourself and your interactions with others. 

In these workshops, you will have the opportunity to learn about embodiment through a variety of exercises and activities over a period of 4 days, held at Zuzalu. We will guide you through practices such as breathwork, movement, meditation, and mindfulness, all of which are designed to help you tune in to your body and cultivate awareness.

We hope that if you join, you commit to the entire experience - from opening ceremony to closing ceremony. Growth happens best in community, ritual, vulnerability, depth and practice and there will be people who are trained to hold you in your deepest moments. Moving your body can bring up emotions that have been suppressed, and finally give them expression. Express and release. We all have pent up emotions. You are not alone. These emotions deserve to be expressed, they deserve to have a voice and a movement, and ohhhh does it feel good.  

No prior experience is required, and we welcome individuals of all levels of fitness and ability. Our facilitators will be on hand to offer guidance and support throughout the workshop.

Come join us and explore the fascinating world of embodiment!


Embodiment Workshop

name: Roundtable Topics Lunch: ZKML
description:
Join us for the ZK Roundtable Topic Lunches and chat with fellow Zuzalu community members about existing and future zk use cases and applications. 

The lunches will be held in a relaxed and informal setting and are open to individuals of all levels of expertise. They will take place on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at 21 Bistro, starting at 12 noon. Each lunch will have a unique theme and a set of guiding questions to help drive the discussion. Come and brainstorm some novel zk use-cases with us, and learn more about the exciting world of zk tech.

Lunch will be paid for by Zuzalu/0xPARC. We've reserved space for up to 30 people, first come, first served. If reserved tables are full, you're welcome to join in the conversation but you'll need to pay for your own order.

name: Introduction to Compute Over Data
description: Compute Over Data (CoD) is an innovative approach emphasizing decentralized compute, AI, and data processing.

name: Powdr - a framework for zkVMs
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: Powdr (https://github.com/chriseth/powdr) is a language and compiler framework for zkVMs. It provides a tooling stack for user-defined zkISAs relying on execution traces with lookups. Powdr provides an assembly and a polynomial identity languages, where constant polynomials are defined in the language itself. Witnesses are generated deterministically and automatically during the compilation process. As a PoC, we have implemented a subset of RISCV in Powdr, where you can make ZKPs about no-std Rust programs directly.

name: Scaling Ethereum with Zero Knowledge Proofs
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: Introduction to rollups and the zkEVM. Beginner session for getting people of all backgrounds into rollups and how zero-knowledge is used in some of the use cases.

name: How to build with Semaphore
equipment: Screen and projector. AV support! Would be great to have it recorded
description:
Participants can expect to learn what Semaphore is and how to use it to build privacy-preserving applications.

Semaphore was used to build Zuzalupass. 

Audience:
Developers of all kinds of levels interested in zk. People interested in knowing more about zk projects.

name: SuperNova and Parallelising Nova
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description: Continuing our deep dive on Nova, this workshop will explore the details of SuperNova and parallelised Nova proving. We will discuss the intricacies of SuperNova and the new paradigm of IVC it introduces (NIVC). Then, we'll dive into an orthogonal idea that further enhances the efficiency of Nova provers in practical settings: parallelization of Nova and SuperNova proving! Additionally, we will share some insights, benchmarks, and challenges observed in concrete experiments with a parallelised Nova implementation as part of a recent Nova zkVM effort.

name: Poseidon: The Missing Infra for Building zkDApps
equipment: AV for recording/amplification would be great!
description:
In this workshop, we present Poseidon, the missing infra for building zkDApps on Ethereum. Poseidon provides three things: 1) composable ZKP primitives as smart contract so that DApp developers don’t have to write ZKP circuits on their own. 2) DApp SDK that helps the DApp developers build ZKP proof generation on client side (e.g. browser). 3) ZK-ZK Aggregator that aggregates a batch of client generated proofs into a single proof so that the amortized ZKP verification cost (gas cost) can be greatly reduced.

The workshop will include talks about the architecture, demos of building zkDApps, and panel discussion about co-processor architecture.

Audience: People who are interested in ZK technology, Ethereum Developers that don't know too much about ZK but want to build zkDApps.

In these workshops, you will have the opportunity to learn about embodiment through a variety of exercises and activities over a period of 4 days, held at Zuzalu. name: Muse Dance Party
description:
If the Oxford Muse Dinner had a baby with a dance party, this would be it! We will combine the joy of movement and the power of vulnerability to foster deep connections and authentic human interactions.

We will start with a dynamic and energizing dance session, where you'll be invited to move freely and let your body express itself without any judgment or inhibition.

We will gradually introduce the element of vulnerability by pairing participants off and inviting them to answer questions. These questions are designed to create a safe and supportive environment where you can share your thoughts, feelings, and experiences with others who are open and receptive to listening.

You'll leave the event feeling inspired, uplifted, and connected to a community of like-minded people who share your desire for authentic human connections.

This is a welcoming and inclusive space for anyone who wants to explore the power of vulnerability and connection through dance. Come join us and let your heart beat to the rhythm of life!

name: The future of decentralized social media and web3 social
equipment: Need panel setting and virtual board-casting & Zoom
description: The landscape of social media is rapidly evolving., While decentralization and blockchain technology begin redefining how online communities interact, share, and create value the network effects of existing Web2 social platforms result in strong inertia for true innovation. This series of discussions aims to explore the current state and the exciting future of decentralized social media and Web3 social platforms. We invite the creators and developers of social media to come together and discuss how we may overcome the inertia and cold start problems to grow the user base of Web3 social. We also invite everyone to imagine what  Web3 social may look like. To imagine a decentralized future requires a plurality of minds and ideas.

name: An Architecture for Collective Intelligence
description: Humanity has figured out enough technical solutions to achieve collective intelligence. Now we just need to piece them together into a whole. We propose a coordination protocol that's invariant to your perspective of the world, your values in that world, and the situation you're in. It seems more effective and efficient than money.
